Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2012 05:10PM kmwondering wrote: Cynthia. Thanks so much for your thoughts and words here. They mean a lot. I appreciate your thoughts on breastfeeding as well. Amazing how little so many MDs know about it. I've made the choice to wean him from the left side only for now. Righty has always been favored anyway ;) I got the cd of my images ready to bring to the BS tomorrow. This board is wonderfull for many reasons. I feel ready to advocate for myself in order to know for certain what this is. I will keep you in my thoughts as well. Scared-I will absolute update at the resolution of this, whatever it may be. I think it is important to let people know. Anamerty-I am sorry you are going through this and I so hope you have a good result. You may get more answers by posting a new thread with your questions.  I don't really know.
Posts.Title: Palpable lump, negative ultrasound kmwondering Janet456

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2012 09:45PM kmwondering wrote: Thank you for your reply, Cynthia. I appreciate your insight. I am a bit better today. After all, whatever it is, is already there. Nothing worrying will change. I have an appt with a recommended (for skill and kind bedside manner!) breast surgeon this coming Tuesday and will see what she recommends. They said no mammogram because I am breastfeeding? hmmm, you may well be right about that radiologist. Well, the surgeon can order whatever imaging she thinks is necessary. I had been planning to wean anyway, this will just move up my timetable a bit as I'm reading that it would be much better for any biopsy or surgery. I just want whatever it is out. It is causing pain and awful anxiety.
Posts.Title: Palpable lump, negative ultrasound kmwondering Janet456

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2012 05:01PM kmwondering wrote: Thanks Janet. I certainly hope it is something along those lines. I am anxious to get to my appointment.
Posts.Title: Palpable lump, negative ultrasound kmwondering Janet456

Posts.Content: kmwondering wrote: Hello all. I'm a 33 year old mom of 2. My second is 14 months and I am still nursing him. I noticed a small movable lump that is sometimes painful. Difficult to describe, not sore or tender, more of a nerve type pain.  They found a cyst on my ultrasound but it is NOT where the palpable lump is. The tech was very patient and brought the radiologist in. Ultrasound shows nothing where I know there is something. I don't think my ob will hesitate to refer me to the breast surgeon. I'm pretty scared. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Palpable lump, negative ultrasound kmwondering Janet456

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2012 07:48PM kmwondering wrote: Well, I had a very good appointment today at the BS. Seems that the imaging department and I were across purposes with a maddeningly anxious outcome. The palpable lump was a simple cyst which she aspirated. Thank you everyone here.  and I wish you all well on your journeys.
